questions.question_text_1: Presently a lot of software development takes place in a distributed environment, the developer is expected to write precise interface definitions. From the given options, which is/are TRUE about interface definition.
question_texts: Presently a lot of software development takes place in a distributed environment, the developer is expected to write precise interface definitions. From the given options, which is/are TRUE about interface definition.

options.option_text: It describes the capabilities of a function
It provides the implementation details of a function
It tells which requests are allowed and specifies the format of the output
The code implementing the interface should remain unchanged for a giveninterface definition

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct statements regarding software organizations.
question_texts: Choose the correct statements regarding software organizations.

options.option_text: In a flat organizational structure, there are fewer levels of hierarchy,promoting a more collaborative environment
Agile methodologies are primarily suitable for large, bureaucraticorganizations
DevOps is a cultural and professional movement that aims to improvecollaboration between software development and IT operations
Waterfall model is an agile software development methodology
The Scrum framework defines roles, events, and artifacts for organizing andmanaging work

questions.question_text_1: What are the primary applications of knowledge sharing tools in software development?
question_texts: What are the primary applications of knowledge sharing tools in software development?

options.option_text: The tools can be used for sharing documents and archiving decisions
The tools enable all members of the team to get a big picture of the projectalong with a detailed view of its progress
The tools can be used to apply the knowledge gained in one project to anotherproject
The tools mainly include IDEs that help the developers to be more productive

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct statements regarding Test-Driven Development (TDD).
question_texts: Choose the correct statements regarding Test-Driven Development (TDD).

options.option_text: TDD involves writing test cases after the implementation of the code
TDD encourages developers to write production code without any testing
In TDD, tests are written to validate the expected behavior of the code beforethe code is implemented
TDD is not suitable for agile development methodologies

questions.question_text_1: Choose the correct statements about continuous integration (CI).
question_texts: Choose the correct statements about continuous integration (CI).

options.option_text: CI is a software development practice where code changes are tested andintegrated into the main codebase frequently
Jenkins and Travis CI are examples of CI tools
CI helps identify and fix integration issues early in the development process
Continuous Deployment (CD) is synonymous with continuous integration
CI is only beneficial for small development teams

questions.question_text_1: A programmer is developing a module for a big software project. The module has 50 functions. After writing the code, the programmer has observed that he is not getting the desired output, and he suspects some of the functions are not getting called. In order to identify those functions, he places some print statements in all the functions.  What kind of debugging technique does the programmer employ in this case?
question_texts: A programmer is developing a module for a big software project. The module has 50 functions. After writing the code, the programmer has observed that he is not getting the desired output, and he suspects some of the functions are not getting called. In order to identify those functions, he places some print statements in all the functions.  What kind of debugging technique does the programmer employ in this case?

questions.question_text_1: Consider a program that has classes CashPayment , CardPayment and UPIPayment , which are derived from class Payment . However, in the functions, changing the object types from derived class to the base class causes various errors in the program.  Which of the SOLID principles is violated by the program?
question_texts: Consider a program that has classes CashPayment , CardPayment and UPIPayment , which are derived from class Payment . However, in the functions, changing the object types from derived class to the base class causes various errors in the program.  Which of the SOLID principles is violated by the program?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements are true about the staging environment?
question_texts: Which of the following statements are true about the staging environment?

options.option_text: It provides the local environment to a software developer which contains thetools like IDE
It provides an environment with several testing tools and focuses onintegration testing
It provides an environment that exactly resembles the productionenvironment
It provides the actual production environment

questions.question_text_1: Consider the following classes: BMI, HeightConverter, and WeightConverter. Class BMI considers the height and weight of a person in CMs and KGs respectively and then computes the person's BMI(body mass index). However, the input is collected in the form of Feet and Pounds. Class HeightConverter converts the height from Feet to CM, and class WeightConverter converts weight from Pound to KG. But, unfortunately, the class BMI is not compatible with HeightConverter, and WeightConverter.  Therefore, we apply design pattern X to solve the problem, and represent the class diagram as follows:
questions.question_text_2: Consider the following classes: BMI, HeightConverter, and WeightConverter. Class BMI considers the height and weight of a person in CMs and KGs respectively and then computes the person's BMI(body mass index). However, the input is collected in the form of Feet and Pounds. Class HeightConverter converts the height from Feet to CM, and class WeightConverter converts weight from Pound to KG. But, unfortunately, the class BMI is not compatible with HeightConverter, and WeightConverter.  Therefore, we apply design pattern X to solve the problem, and represent the class diagram as follows:    Identify the design pattern referred to above as X.
question_texts: Consider the following classes: BMI, HeightConverter, and WeightConverter. Class BMI considers the height and weight of a person in CMs and KGs respectively and then computes the person's BMI(body mass index). However, the input is collected in the form of Feet and Pounds. Class HeightConverter converts the height from Feet to CM, and class WeightConverter converts weight from Pound to KG. But, unfortunately, the class BMI is not compatible with HeightConverter, and WeightConverter.  Therefore, we apply design pattern X to solve the problem, and represent the class diagram as follows:

Consider the following classes: BMI, HeightConverter, and WeightConverter. Class BMI considers the height and weight of a person in CMs and KGs respectively and then computes the person's BMI(body mass index). However, the input is collected in the form of Feet and Pounds. Class HeightConverter converts the height from Feet to CM, and class WeightConverter converts weight from Pound to KG. But, unfortunately, the class BMI is not compatible with HeightConverter, and WeightConverter.  Therefore, we apply design pattern X to solve the problem, and represent the class diagram as follows:    Identify the design pattern referred to above as X.

1 is a micro-decisions, but 2 is a macro decision

questions.question_text_1: IDEs are very useful in the software development process, mainly because ___________ .

options.option_text: they are useful in documenting and archiving knowledge of one project so thatit can be reused in another project
they are useful for sharing documents and archiving decisions
they enable all the members of the team to get a big picture as well as adetailed view of progress in the software development
they help the developers become more productive

questions.question_text_1: Consider a program that takes a number as input. If the input number is not an integer it generates an error. Otherwise, it identifies the integer as even or odd.  Identify the number of equivalence classes for black box testing of the program.
